security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only TypeScript/Python code examples. No executable code, scripts, network calls, file system access, environment variable reads, or external commands detected.

content.user_title: Implement React Native authentication in Expo apps
content.value_statement: React Native authentication requires careful handling of OAuth flows, secure token storage, and session management. This skill provides battle-tested patterns for implementing login with Google, token storage with SecureStore, protected routes with Expo Router, and backend integration.
actual_capabilities: Implement Google OAuth using expo-auth-session with proper redirect handling
Store tokens securely using expo-secure-store instead of AsyncStorage
Create authentication context with session restoration on app launch
Protect routes using Expo Router segments and auth state
Send authenticated API requests with Bearer tokens
Debug common authentication issues like redirect URI mismatch
limitations: Contains documentation and code patterns only, no executable implementation
Does not include backend server code beyond Python reference examples
Apple Sign-In patterns are mentioned but not fully detailed
Does not cover biometric authentication or passkey integration

prompt_templates.title: Basic Google Sign-In
prompt_templates.scenario: Add Google authentication to Expo app
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to implement Google sign-in using expo-auth-session in my React Native Expo app. Include proper redirect handling and token storage.

prompt_templates.title: Secure Token Storage
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I securely store and retrieve authentication tokens in React Native using expo-secure-store? Show me the complete implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Protected Routes
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I protect routes in Expo Router so unauthenticated users are redirected to login? Show the auth context and route guard implementation.

prompt_templates.title: API Client with Auth
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an authenticated API client for my Expo app that automatically adds Bearer tokens, handles 401 errors, and attempts token refresh on expiry.

output_examples.input: How do I implement Google sign-in in my Expo React Native app?
output: Use expo-auth-session with expo-web-browser for OAuth flows
Call WebBrowser.maybeCompleteAuthSession() at module level for proper redirect handling
Use expo-secure-store for token storage (not AsyncStorage)
Get iOS client ID for device, web client ID for backend verification
Use AuthSession.makeRedirectUri() to handle both Expo Go and standalone builds
Validate tokens with your backend before trusting user data from OAuth providers

best_practices: Always call maybeCompleteAuthSession() at module level to handle OAuth redirects properly
Use expo-secure-store for tokens, never AsyncStorage which is not encrypted
Validate tokens with your backend before trusting user data from OAuth providers
Handle 401 responses by attempting token refresh or forcing logout
anti_patterns: Storing tokens in AsyncStorage - it is not encrypted and accessible to any app code
Skipping maybeCompleteAuthSession() - causes silent auth redirect failures
Using iOS client ID for backend token verification - always use web client ID server-side
Not handling different redirect URIs for Expo Go versus standalone builds

faq.question: Does this skill work with Expo Go and standalone builds?
faq.answer: Yes. Use AuthSession.makeRedirectUri() to automatically generate the correct redirect URI for each environment.

faq.question: What React Native versions are supported?
faq.answer: This skill targets Expo SDK 48+ with expo-auth-session 6+. Compatible with React Native 0.73 and later.

faq.question: How do I integrate with my existing backend?
faq.answer: Use the authFetch pattern that attaches Bearer tokens to requests. Handle 401 responses with token refresh or logout.

faq.question: Is my authentication data stored securely?
faq.answer: The skill recommends expo-secure-store which uses iOS Keychain and Android Keystore. Never use AsyncStorage for tokens.

faq.question: Why does auth fail silently in my app?
faq.answer: Most common cause is missing WebBrowser.maybeCompleteAuthSession() call at module level. Also check redirect URI matching.

faq.question: How does this compare to Firebase Auth?
faq.answer: This skill shows native OAuth patterns. Firebase Auth provides a higher-level abstraction but requires the Firebase SDK and Google services.
